projectDesc.p: "From the 5th Book of Love. Poem 1384." is published by The Global Medieval Sourcebook (GMS), a free, open access, and open source compendium of medieval texts in their original languages and in English translation. GMS comprises computer-readable transcriptions or editions alongside new translations of texts dating from the ninth to the sixteenth century and originating in Europe, North Africa, the Middle East, and Asia. The GMS platform includes critical introductions as well as sources for further reading.

editorialDecl.p: Transcriptions and translations are encoded in XML conforming to TEI (P5) guidelines. The original-language text is contained within <lem> tags and translations within <rdg> tags.

interpretation.p: Texts are translated into modern American English with maximum fidelity to the original text, except where it would impair comprehension or good style. Archaisms are preserved where they do not conflict with the aesthetic of the original text. Scribal errors and creative translation choices are marked and discussed in the critical notes.

app.rdg: From the love poems of the Empress.

app.lem: よそなりし其夜に人は歸れども身は改めぬ物をこそ思へ
app.rdg:
We’re strangers again,
and now my lover’s gone back
to before we met,
while I’m here stuck with the same
thoughts of him, thoughts of our time.
